schedules.title: RuPaul's Drag Race UK
schedules.desc: S7 E7 RuPaul presents the Snatch game with a new twist, which sees the queens showcase their best celebrity dating and improvisation skills as they fight for the affections of broadcaster Jordan North in a special edition of Snatch Me Out. Michelle Visage and Alan Carr are joined in the panel by comedy actress Susan Wokoma.

schedules.title: Absolutely Fabulous: The Movie
schedules.desc: Comedy based on the popular TV series, starring Jennifer Saunders and Joanna Lumley. Scatterbrained socialites Edina and Patsy go on the run after they're suspected of killing model Kate Moss at a glitzy event. Attempting to make a new life on the French Riviera, they hatch a plan to get rich quick, all while being pursued by their singer nemesis, Lulu.

schedules.desc:
S2025 08/11/2025
Matt Tebbutt is joined by Sam Holland, Jeremy Lee and Crystelle Pereira, as well as Celebrity Traitors star Joe Marler. Olly Smith picks the drinks to go with the studio dishes.

schedules.title: The Lady Mayor's Show 2025
schedules.desc: Katie Derham presents coverage of the civic parade in the City of London, celebrating the appointment of Susan Langley. Tina Daheley catches up with participants on the ground. Featuring an appearance by the hydroplane Bluebird K7 alongside the Pearly Kings and Queens.

schedules.title: Football Focus : 08/11/2025
schedules.desc: Alex Scott and guests look ahead to the weekend's matches, including Manchester City v Liverpool. Plus, news from the lunchtime game between Tottenham Hotspur and Manchester United.

schedules.title: Bargain Hunt
schedules.desc:
S62 Oswestry 31 and 32 (Series 62-64 Extended Versions)
Kate Bliss and Richard Madley assist the teams in Oswestry, Shropshire, while Christina Trevanion visits the costume department at the Royal Shakespeare Company.

schedules.title: Live International Rugby League : England v Australia 08.11 ᴸᶦᵛᵉ
schedules.desc: England v Australia (Kick-off 2.30pm). Coverage of the third and final match of the Ashes series, which takes place at AMT Headingley Stadium in Leeds. This is the first meeting between the sides at this ground since 1975, when England claimed a 12-0 win, but the Kangaroos thrashed Great Britain 44-4 on their last visit to the venue in 2004.

schedules.title: Final Score : 08/11/2025
schedules.desc: Jason Mohammad presents a round-up of the results and this afternoon's news from the Premier League, EFL and Scotland.

schedules.title: The Celebrity Inner Circle
schedules.desc: S1 E6 Richie Anderson, Tasha Ghouri, JB Gill, Una Healy, Tamzin Outhwaite and Nina Wadia are paired with six contestants hoping to outwit each other to win big in the celebrity version of the quiz show, hosted by Amanda Holden.

schedules.title: Strictly Come Dancing
schedules.desc:
S23 E13 Week 7 2025
The couples show off another routine in a bid to impress judges Shirley Ballas, Craig Revel Horwood, Motsi Mabuse and Anton Du Beke, as well as the viewers, in the hope of avoiding the fate of last week's eliminated couple Ellie and Vito. They'll be working hard to stay as far away from the bottom of the leaderboard as possible - but as the series has proved, that's no guarantee of avoiding the dance off. Presented by Tess Daly and Claudia Winkleman.

schedules.title: Michael McIntyre's The Wheel
schedules.desc: S6 E3 The comedian hosts the quiz show with the giant spinning wheel, with Ed Gamble, Jonathan Ross, Liz Bonnin, the Rev Richard Coles, Jo Brand, Francis Bourgeois and AJ Odudu advising the contestants as they answer their way to a fortune.

schedules.title: Royal British Legion Festival of Remembrance 2025
schedules.desc: The annual commemorative performance from the Royal Albert Hall, featuring performances from Rod Stewart, Blessing Offor, Sam Ryder, Keala Settle and the Wellermen, as well as the Central Band of the RAF, the RAF Squadronaires, the King's Colour Squadron, and The Band of HM Royal Marines. The Festival will commemorate both the 80th anniversary of the end of the Second World War and the 25th anniversary of the UK Government lifting the ban on gay, lesbian, and bisexual personnel serving openly in the armed forces.

schedules.title: Match of the Day : 08/11/2025
schedules.desc: Highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Tottenham Hotspur v Manchester United at Tottenham Hotspur Stadium and Sunderland v Arsenal at Stadium of Light. Spurs were looking for another victory over United after defeating them four times last season, including in the UEFA Europa League final. The Gunners are aiming to go one better than in each of the last three seasons and win the title, but faced a test of their credentials against the Black Cats, who had made an impressive start to the campaign. Plus, Everton v Fulham, West Ham United v Burnley and Chelsea v Wolverhampton Wanderers.
